item.title: Bare Metal: DS18B20
item.description:
I’ve been working through Google’s Comprehensive Rust and, for the past couple of weeks, the Bare Metal Rust standalone course that uses the (excellent) micro:bit v2 that uses a Nordic Semiconductor nRF52833 (an ARM Cortex-M4; interestingly its USB interface is also implemented using an ARM Cortex M0).

There’s a wealth of Rust tutorials for MCUs and I bought an ESP32-C3-DevKit-RUST-1 for another and spent some time with my favorite Pi Pico and a newly-acquired Debug Probe.

I’m going to blog in reverse order on these experiences starting with several unsuccessful attempts to interact with 5 DS18B20 (thermometer) sensors using Rust and an ESP32-C3 and Python and a Pico primarily for my own documentation and hope it helps others. DS18B20s use 1-Wire. 1-Wire is a very straightforward protocol (akin to 12C, SPI etc.) is a serial communication protocol that, as its name hints, uses a single wire for data (can also use this data wire for “parasitic” power).
